item.title: Pot holes on both sides of the road, 23rd February
item.description:

item.title: Huge pot hole with nasty edges outside Churchdown club fence, 23rd February
item.description:
Outside Churchdown club fence just by bus stop. Very large, deep pot hole. Getting bigger by the day due to it being driven over by the buses ! Saw a large vehicle hit it earlier & they damaged their wheel !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Church Road, Churchdown, Gloucester

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 23rd February
item.description:
Drainage crew with a tanker lorry attended site today to clear the highways culvert/soakaway at location. During this process, they pumped the excess water (3000 gallons) over the property fenceline, letting it run down into the lake on the property. Customer is looking to make contact regarding this incident, and to resolve the ongoing issue of this culvert collecting all the surface water from the road and channelling it into their lake (as opposed to the nearby river).
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Itâ€™s not just one pothole it is dangerously damaged road surfaces which have been left unrepaired for months. This is a very busy road and home to many people with children and young people using bicycles. Cars are driving dangerously trying to avoid the central damaged roads. It is an utter disgrace for this Festival town of Cheltenham, 23rd February
item.description:
The location covers both sides of the road centrally and cannot be avoided due to parked cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 23rd February
item.description:
email rec 12/02/2024 - Hello Please could the timings on the traffic lights at Princess Elizabeth Way in Cheltenham at the Kingsditch roundabout be reviewed. Coming from PE Way only about 6 cars progress on to the roundabout before the lights turn red again. It is causing significant tailbacks all the way down to Coronation Square and towards the A40. The timings seem to have changed after the resurfacing work on PE Way completed just over a week ago.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Long trench type pothole, 23rd February
item.description:
Located at junction of Sandford Road and College Lawn. Large trench pothole at junction is creating more gravel every day as it widens creating a hazard to motorists due to potential windscreen damage. This is also across the exit of Keynsham Road creating severe lurching of vehicles exiting on to Sandford Road. This is regularly used by the fire station vehicles. This pothole is adjacent to a pothole reported in December and now repaired.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandford Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
